aneuploidy: The occurrence of cells with an inconsistent and irregular distribution of chromosomal sets, resulting in an imbalance of genetic material, which can manifest in the presence of abnormal cells alongside normally paired chromosomes, often leading to increased variability in a population.

mixoploidy: The occurrence of a plant population that harbors both cells with an intact, paired set of chromosomes and cells with an aberrant number of chromosomes, resulting in a mosaic of karyotypes within a single individual or among a group of individuals.
